subtitles.text: Thank you for watching
ME
Reinforcing the new center

This is a project to strengthen the new center, where you will learn the skills necessary to be the center while digging deeper into the personality of Inoue, who will play the center for the first time in the new song released on the market.
So far, we've challenged you to a quiz about Inoue. 4 incorrect answers and now the prize money is down to 50,000 yen.
How much prize money will remain?
Speaking of Inoue, we all know that he is good at drawing, and this is the most famous of all.
Which one is Mr. Nimura written by Nagi Inoue?
It's easy, so I'll leave it to you.
Here's the first one, Mr. Himura.
What's this?
Here's Mr. Himura, No. 2
He's so kind!
Here's Mr. Himura, number 3.
That's nice. I'm so happy.
Here's Mr. Himura, number 4.
Look!
I think they look alike.
Many people say it's the closest resemblance.

I don't like this in real life.
There's a touch like this, too.
Other than the correct answer above, the other members also wrote their own drawings.
But you can tell they're all Mr. Himura.
There's something distinctive about him.
Number 5 has an art school touch.
I wonder what it is.
It's a close-up of something that's a little off-putting.

Nagi's touch is more of a cartoon pansy style

No, no, no.
No, no, no, no, no...
They're similar, but...

Let's do it.

That's right.

He was a good guy.

You're good.

Next is the final question, and the winner is Kawasaki. If he gets it wrong, he gets zero yen.
10,000 yen! I really want you to collect it no matter what!
I'll do my best.
I'll do my best.
Question: What made Inoue Nagi's mother cry?
Yes, sir.
Four points.
The first time she left her rice.
Yes, I did.
No.2 she made a hole in the wall of her room.
Yes.
Number 3, cut my own hair from the roots in bunches.
Yes.
Number 4, I had a brother who was 10 years younger than me.
Which one is it?
I don't think I'd ever do something as violent as a bowel movement.
I don't think I'd do anything violent.
But I think number 3 is surprising.
Number 3.
My sister once cut her hair like Kintaro's, right at the base of the bangs.
It reminded me of that.
From a mother's point of view, but there's also number 2, isn't there?
She cut a hole in her room.
I wonder how big a hole she made.
I made a hole in the shape of my own person.I've made a hole in my own humanoid.
I don't know if I'll ever get out of here like that.
I'm going to cry.

The correct answer is number 3.

He's falling asleep.
What's wrong?
Correct!
You got it!
Congratulations, you got it right.
There it is.
It means you cut your own hair by the width of it.
What does this mean?
When I was a little girl, I tied my own twin-tails with rubber bands.
Yes, yes.
They get tangled.
Tangled? Rubber bands...
With rubber bands, my hair would get all tangled up and I couldn't get it out.
My mom would get mad if she found out.
I thought if I pulled it out from the roots, she wouldn't know.
Pulling out twin-tails is such a hard job, isn't it?
It's really scary.
But you can't pull it out.
So I went down to the root here and cut it all off.
I've already cut it from the end of the rubber band.
If it's gone from the root, it doesn't exist.
What?
This is where I was when I was in the first grade.
First grade.
Do you remember how long it was, overall?
It was a lot longer than it is now when I was little.
huh?

For this hit period, Inoue, who is playing the center for the first time, went to her hometown by herself as a "Hitori-sama Heaven".
While visiting memorable places, she will thank 33 of her friends and benefactors for their kindness and support.
Inoue will report that he has become the center of the group and campaign for the new song.
Almost this.
That was the other day.
When I was in high school, I was mostly involved in club activities.
We had morning practice, then class, then club activities, then back home.
I did it on weekdays and holidays.
I was in the ball club.This is the ball club!
The members of the same grade are all good friends.
I still hang out with them and go out to eat with them.
I ended up changing high schools.
But I still want to keep in touch with them.
I think they are people I want to stay in touch with now and in the future.
Let's start with the rice bowl club.
That brings back memories.
I'm so glad.
I used to walk home.
It took me an hour or so from home.
If I took the train, I'd have to walk about 10 minutes to get here.
I would go by myself.
I used to walk home alone.
Fuji from the high school.
Fuji, so I decided to come here.
Fuji in the summer sunset.
It was so beautiful and I was secretly looking forward to it.
Oh, the dojo!
This dojo is distorted in many places.
It leaks, the lock won't lock, you can't get in, you can't close the cutter.
I couldn't get in, and the cutter wouldn't close.
It was a tough time.
I can see that everyone is still using it beautifully.
It's still so beautiful.
I miss it
It's beautiful.

You mean they're all going in?

I liked it.
I want you to do it.I want you to do it.
You used to spring up in Asaren every day.
I used to come in at 5:30 in the morning.
I'd get a little exercise.
I'd walk to school for at least an hour.
I'd do Asaren, and then I'd go to class.
I'd do club activities.
I would go to cram school at home.
I would come home around 11:00 p.m.
That's my daily routine.
It's hard work.
The head of the club?
She was someone I could talk to about all kinds of things.
Like about auditions.
I told her that I wasn't sure if I wanted to go for it or not even before I got it.
I think she was the only one
She thought about it with me.
So every time I passed an audition

Thank you so much for your support and for watching
Thank you so much for your support and for watching "Nogizaka Kenkenchu".
